innhold.avsnitt: As a father or co-mother, you can begin your parental benefit period from week 7 after birth. If you are adopting, the parental benefit period will commence when care of the child is assumed.
If you adopt from abroad, you can choose if you would like to start receiving the parental benefit when you assume care of the child while abroad, or the day you arrive in Norway with the child.
If you start later, you will receive fewer weeks of the parental benefit if you do not apply for a postponement.
If it is not convenient to take full leave from work, you can take your parental benefit in combination with partial work or postpone because you are working fulltime.
Both when you take the parental benefit or postpone this, the mother must either

liste.punkt: combining study with work that together makes it full-time
be fully dependent on assistance to take care of the child due to sickness
participating fulltime in the Introduction Programme for newly arrived immigrants pursuant to chapter 2 of the Introduction Act

lesmer.intro: Is the mother receiving disability benefit?
lesmer.avsnitt: If the mother is receiving disability benefit, you may take up to 15 weeks at 100 per cent parental benefit, or 19 weeks at 80 per cent parental benefit without the mother having an activity requirement. These weeks must be taken before 46 weeks after the child was born if you choose 100 per cent parental benefit, or 56 weeks after the child was born if you choose 80 per cent parental benefit. If you are taking more than these weeks, the mother must be working, studying or in another approved activity when you are at home with the child or if you are postponing parental benefit.
